title: Sunfall by Jamie Frith
text:
Sunfall by Jamie Frith
“This is a picture of my wife, Elyse. I didn’t want the highlights blown out, so I positioned her with the sun out of frame, creating an amazing golden light shining through her hair.”

title: Superbaby by Isabel Cortes Parra
text:
Superbaby by Isabel Cortes Parra
“This is one of the photos of my little son, taken for a project of his first months. It was taken on the bed, with home clothes to make the composition.”

title: The Pair by Paul Vecsei
text:
The Pair by Paul Vecsei
“I took this at a small stream in British Columbia. I waited for over half an hour for the salmon to get used to me, but it was worth it as this pair came close by.”

title: Silver Lining by Rohan Reilly
text:
Silver Lining by Rohan Reilly
“I took this shot in Carlow, West Cork, Ireland. I’d been out shooting seascapes, but as the mist rose in this field behind me, I knew I had to make the most of this photo opportunity.”

title: The Red Dot by Jared Lim
text:
The Red Dot by Jared Lim
“I took this shot during my holiday in Peru while I was in a small plane flying over the Nazca Desert. I was lucky enough to see this striking red car driving alone along the Pan American Highway.”

title: Pyramid First Light by Chris Tostevin-Hall
text:
Pyramid First Light by Chris Tostevin-Hall
“I took this shot of Pyramid Lake just before 8am, just west of Jasper, Alberta. I waited until most of the early morning mist cleared, leaving this remaining misty cloud to add to the ambience of the scene.”

title: White Wolf by Heather Allen
text:
White Wolf by Heather Allen
“This grey wolf was taken at Woodland Park Zoo in Seattle. I took the shot as the wolves were being fed small fish. This wolf was the beta of the pack and hung back a little.”

title: Shadows by Stavros Stamatiou
text:
Shadows by Stavros Stamatiou
“This was taken late in the afternoon outside the small Orthodox church of Agia Marina, in the village of Myrsini, Greece.”

title: Neck Deep by Gary Seloff
text:
Neck Deep by Gary Seloff
“This shot of a green heron was captured from my kayak in an undeveloped area of the Armand Bayou Nature Center, southeast of Houston, Texas. The bayou supports a healthy population of fish as well as a variety of birds.”

title: Fire Dancer by Graham Crumb
text:
Fire Dancer by Graham Crumb
“A member of the Vanua Fire Dance Group performs at a resort in Port Vila, Vanuatu in the South Pacific.”

title: Issue 49 out now for iPad AND iPhone!
text:
Issue 49 out now for iPad AND iPhone!
Take a back-yard safari with this issue’s feature, which is packed with advice on getting amazing shots of everything from butterflies and bugs to flowers and frogs, all without leaving your garden. The tips and techniques are guaranteed to help you improve your nature shots this weekend!

title: Volcano in Hawaii by Alain Barbezat
text:
Volcano in Hawaii by Alain Barbezat
“This was taken on Hawaii’s Big Island, where this volcano was active. After a four hour drive and hiking on challenging terrain, we got to this view point. I was able to capture this epic battle between water and fire.”

title: Gypsy Boys by Isac Goulart
text:
Gypsy Boys by Isac Goulart
“This was taken at a gypsy camp in Brazil. Once the kids here saw my camera, they just wanted to be in front of the camera. I got a few fantastic shots, which I printed and gave them each a copy.”

title: Curiosity by Gabriel Marian
text:
Curiosity by Gabriel Marian
“This cat was owned by some of my neighbours after it was abandoned as a kitten. Almost every day it came to sit on the balcony from the second floor of my building in Suceava, Romania.”

title: Star in a Storm by Hugo Marques
text:
Star in a Storm by Hugo Marques
“This was taken at Praia Azul in Santa Cruz, Portugal. On this day the sun set combined with a low tide created the perfect opportunity to photograph this starfish.”

title: Tragopogon Orientalis by Ewa Ciebiera
text:
Tragopogon Orientalis by Ewa Ciebiera
“I took this in a meadow near Morges in Switzerland. I photographed this dandelion (Latin name tragopogon orientalis) against a piece of plastic bag, which created a nice blue background.”

title: Warp Speed by Darren Neupert
text:
Warp Speed by Darren Neupert
“I decided to stop on my way out of Mount Rainier National Park to take this one last shot. It is a composite consisting of a normal exposure, and one where I slowly rotated the aperture ring.”

title: Issue 48 out now for iPad AND iPhone!
text:
Issue 48 out now for iPad AND iPhone!
Want to transform your images overnight without spending a small fortune? Then this week’s feature has the answer: it takes you step by step through the five essential filters that every photographer should own, from circular polarisers to graduated neutral density filters. We look at what they’re for, how to use them, and just why they’re so important.

title: Heart of the Navajo by Darren Neupert
text:
Heart of the Navajo by Darren Neupert
“The walls of Lower Antelope Canyon, in Page, Arizona, can show the most brilliant colors early in the morning as they catch the sun.”

title: A New Day by Matteo Zanvettor
text:
A New Day by Matteo Zanvettor
“This spectacular view of the Odle (in the Dolomites mountain range) was taken in northern Italy. I captured this image in the early hours of the morning, taking advantage of the particular formation of clouds and light.”

title: Fisherman by Saravut Whanset
text:
Fisherman by Saravut Whanset
“This was taken in the Wanonniwas district in Sakolnankhon province, Thailand, where fishing is a common occupation for most families.”

title: Ha Long Junk by Michael Rainwater
text:
Ha Long Junk by Michael Rainwater
“We’d spent the night on a tourist junk in a sheltered cove in Ha Long Bay, Vietnam.  Shortly after dawn, I went to the roof deck to have a look around and spotted this boat under sail passing us.”

title: Intense Look by Dinesh Babu
text:
Intense Look by Dinesh Babu
“This was taken in Hanumanthapuram village, in Tamilnadu, India. I saw this colourful background and wanted to add an human element, then I saw this girl climbing on the stairs, so I made the most of this photo opportunity.”

title: Surfing Liquid Copper by David Orias
text:
Surfing Liquid Copper by David Orias
“To capture this shot, I used a slow shutter speed and panned the camera with the motion of the surfer. This had created the texture of the wave. The red color was thanks to a vibrant sunrise.”

title: Balloon Launch in Cappadocia by Michael Morris
text:
Balloon Launch in Cappadocia by Michael Morris
“I took the image in Cappadocia, Turkey. Each morning at dawn dozens of balloons are launched here. This was a challenging shot to take, as we were in a rapidly ascending balloon in a low light situation.”

title: A Little Slice of Havana by Liban Yusuf
text:
A Little Slice of Havana by Liban Yusuf
“I love photographing Havana after the sun has set. I’ve been roaming around the city at night for the last nine years, discovering dark little streets that are filled with a soulful serenity.”

title: Bloom by Paul Aparicio
text:
Bloom by Paul Aparicio
“This photo was taken walking through the Dahlia Garden in Golden Gate Park, San Francisco. I was quickly drawn to the distinct shape of this flower and wanted to capture how it appeared to be blooming before my eyes.”

title: Green Grasshopper by Robert Trevis-Smith
text:
Green Grasshopper by Robert Trevis-Smith
“This  is common green grasshopper covered with water droplets. I also used water drops for the surface and background and isolated the grasshopper in the shot using a shallow depth of field.”

title: Sandbox by Achim Tomae
text:
Sandbox by Achim Tomae
“The photo was taken in the Rub al Khali Desert near Abu Dhabi, UAE early in the morning. The colours here change every minute after sunrise.”

title: Full of Colours by Dinesh Babu
text:
Full of Colours by Dinesh Babu
“This was taken in Thiruvalangadu village, near Thiruvallur, Tamilnadu, India. I went for a walk around temple, and on the way I found this little girl, Lakshmi, playing with her sister.”

title: The Lion King by Ania Tuzel
text:
The Lion King by Ania Tuzel
“I went to South Africa with the dream of seeing the Kalahari Lion. On the last day this lion appeared out of nowhere. He walked a few yards, looked at us, and then was gone as quickly as he’d appeared.”

title: Relaxing in Rio by Isac Goulart
text:
Relaxing in Rio by Isac Goulart 
“I took this on Ipanema beach in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. What’s wonderful about the beaches here is that there’s always something to photograph: people playing soccer or volleyball, surfers, couples walking… I fell in love with Rio that day.”

title: Waiting by Alex Greenshpun
text:
Waiting by Alex Greenshpun
“I took this while waiting for a train. It was early in the morning on a very foggy day. I found the atmosphere and slow moments around me fascinating, and luckily had my camera with me to capture them.”

title: Cape Hatteras Lighthouse by Danny Collado
text:
Cape Hatteras Lighthouse by Danny Collado
“Taken on Hatteras Island, North Carolina. While the family played on the beach I took a little walk with my camera and spotted the Hatteras lighthouse over the dunes. The sky is courtesy of Tropical Storm Andrea.”

title: Smelly Feet by Alida Jorissen
text:
Smelly Feet by Alida Jorissen
“This is a ring-tailed lemur at Olmense Zoo. I took this photo because it looks like he has smelly feet – we like to humanise animals, and this is very easy to do with lemurs.”

title: Out on the Bayou by Michelle Morris
text:
Out on the Bayou by Michelle Morris
“This image was taken at Black Bayou Wildlife Refuge in Northeast Louisiana. This is a popular spot for local photographers and nature lovers, and on this foggy morning I was lucky to capture another photographer doing what he loves.”

title: Coyote Pup by Mark Perry
text:
Coyote Pup by Mark Perry
“I was photographing a log cabin in Grand Teton National Park in Wyoming when five coyotes pups suddenly appeared from underneath the cabin and started playing. This pup posed for me on the porch of the cabin.”

title: Giants of the Dark by Dani Diamond
text:
Giants of the Dark by Dani Diamond
“In order to capture the perfect tide level and clouds I went back to this location three days in a row. On the third night conditions were perfect. This is a composition of three images: sky, buildings and water.”

title: Melissa by Alina Esther
text:
Melissa by Alina Esther
“This is my cat, Melissa. I find her very photogenic – she always sticks her tongue out, which gives her a certain charm. I just love to photograph her!”

title: Westminster by James Cooper
text:
Westminster by James Cooper
“Using a tripod I wanted to capture the light trails left by buses on Westminster bridge with the iconic Big Ben in the background. I managed to get a clear shot with no other traffic except the bus passing.”

title: Caterpillar by Hee Jenn Wei
text:
Caterpillar by Hee Jenn Wei
“This caterpillar is covered in rain drops as it sat munching on leaves. This was taking at night after rainfall, in the jungle of Malaysia.”

title: Bare Island Blues by Jay Daly
text:
Bare Island Blues by Jay Daly
“This is a shot of Bare Island in Sydney’s Le Perouse. One clear morning I thought I’d try for something different and opted for a long exposure to smooth out the water and soften the morning light.”

title: The Bridge by David Bouchat
text:
The Bridge by David Bouchat
“This is my 1960 Chevrolet Bel Air. As we both live five minutes away from Golden Gate Bridge, my buddy and I decided to try out his new large format camera. The result was this shot.”

title: Fish Special by Claire Marshall
text:
Fish Special by Claire Marshall
“This image was taken near Leeds in the UK from a hide set up to allow people to photograph kingfishers. It was 6.30am and this female started her day with the biggest fish she could find.”

title: Homestretch by George Hendrix
text:
Homestretch by George Hendrix
“The shot was taken in August last year at the regular Thursday evening summer rodeo in Carbondale, Colorado. This girl was just 13 at the time and finished a run in junior barrel racing.”

title: Rear View Monument Valley by Jeff Clow
text:
Rear View Monument Valley by Jeff Clow
“I was aware of the view at mile marker 13 north of Monument Valley and wanted to craft something different, so I used my rear view mirror as a framing device.”

title: The Observer by Howard Snyder
text:
The Observer by Howard Snyder
“Sunset at Mount Hood from Trillium Lake in Oregon. This is an amazing photographic subject you don’t have to hike miles to reach, making Mount Hood a very popular amongst photographers in the Pacific Northwest.”

title: Burrowing Owl by Cindy Bryant
text:
Burrowing Owl by Cindy Bryant
“I took this shot of a Burrowing Owl in Cape Coral, Florida. I got a brief moment when the clouds opened up just enough to light the scene, providing me with a magic moment to capture this shot.”

title: Amina by Francesco Golla
text:
Amina by Francesco Golla
“‘Anima’ is Italian for ‘soul’. I came to Praia de Adraga beach in Portugal more than six years ago and was haunted by a sense of solitude and peace. I returned to capture this in my photography.”

title: Tale of a terminal - A solitary thought by Rahat Amin
text:
Tale of a terminal - A solitary thought by Rahat Amin
“I was struck by this kid’s distinctive posture as he stood looking at the train. I got the impression that he was deep in thought and felt compelled to take this photograph.”

title: Daybreak in Canyonlands by Marc Perella
text:
Daybreak in Canyonlands by Marc Perella
“Dawn breaking at Canyonlands National Park, Moab, Utah. As the sun emerged, the underside of Mesa Arch took on a spectacular orange glow. A typical morning has dozens of photographers just waiting for that perfect moment.”

title: Dragonfly by Paul Christopher Taylor
text:
Dragonfly by Paul Christopher Taylor
“One late afternoon I noticed a group of dragonflies gathering around a flowering bush on my front lawn. The lighting was beautiful so I quickly ran inside to retrieve my camera, then returned to the scene to capture this shot.”

title: Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full.
text:
Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full.
Like us on Facebook and share your work with us for the chance to be featured here and in the magazine!

title: Prairie Fire by Wesley Fortin
text:
Prairie Fire by Wesley Fortin
“This image is comprised of two exposures; one of the sky and one of the barn and wheat in the foreground. I blended them together in Photoshop, painting in the sky to match the exposure of the barn.”

title: Bald Eagle vs Sea Lion by Brad Oliver
text:
Bald Eagle vs Sea Lion by Brad Oliver
“This sea lion had been playing with a fish it had caught when a bald eagle saw an opportunity to steal it. As the eagle made its getaway the sea lion leapt out of the water in an attempt to retrieve it.”

title: Palouse Falls by Jason Hatfield
text:
Palouse Falls by Jason Hatfield
“I captured the stunning Palouse Falls in Washington after an all night drive from the Columbia River Gorge. My lack of sleep was rewarded with diffuse golden morning light, making my long exposure image sing.”

title: Coastal Brown Bear by Tin Man Lee
text:
Coastal Brown Bear by Tin Man Lee
“This brown bear is salmon hunting in Katmai National Park, Alaska. I crouched down with water up to my chest to be on eye level with the bear. It took me four hours in the water to capture this shot.”

title: Puffin Landscape by Richard Steel
text:
Puffin Landscape by Richard Steel
“Opportunities for photographing birds with a wide angle lens are infrequent, so when I encountered some confiding puffins on Hornøya Island off northern Norway, I decided to take some shots.”

title: Javan Hawk Eagle by Irawan Subingar
text:
Javan Hawk Eagle by Irawan Subingar
“The Javan Hawk Eagle is the national bird of Indonesia and is commonly called Garuda, from the bird-like creatures in Hindu and Buddhist myths. It is one of the rarest raptors and is on the Endangered species list.”

title: Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full.
text:
Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full. 
Like us on Facebook and share your work with us for the chance to be featured here and in the magazine!

title: If Only I Could Escape by Aaron Fuhrman
text:
If Only I Could Escape by Aaron Fuhrman
“A slow moving weather system with a well defined front line moved past and began to engulf us. I took to the back roads to capture the mood. The outstretched road leads to a fleeting window of clear skies beyond.”

title: Kermit by Jeff Morgan
text:
Kermit by Jeff Morgan
“Taken in early June in French countryside near Crozant, this is the time of the year for frogs to announce their presence. I lay down and crawled to the pond keeping my camera as low to the water as possible.”

title: Tuscany – Light and Shadows by Irca Calikas
text:
Tuscany – Light and Shadows by Irca Calikas
“This is Crete Sienesi, Tuscany, early in the morning when the light is soft. I’ve visited this area many times, and it is often difficult to find the right location and light, but on this occasion it was perfect.”

title: Le Port d’Essaouria by Ivo Berg
text:
Le Port d’Essaouria by Ivo Berg
“I love travel photography. The port of Essaouira, Morocco certainly was one of the most lively and vibrant places I have ever been to. Just recently I started an adventurous photography journey through South East Asia. Follow the adventure here”

title: The Hungry Caterpillar by Charlotte Gravatt
text:
The Hungry Caterpillar by Charlotte Gravatt
“When taking ‘Plantlife' photos for an Online Weekly Project Group, I stumbled upon this tiny caterpillar on some 'sticky weed’ in the hedgerow. If I wasn’t looking through the macro lens I may have missed it!”

title: Little Tarn by Perri Schelat
text:
Little Tarn by Perri Schelat
“This is Mount Kidd in Alberta, Canada. I used a three-stop graduated neutral density filter to hold back the brightness of the sky and mountain , and a polariser to reduce reflection.”

title: Ring-necked Duck by Tim King
text:
Ring-necked Duck by Tim King
“I took this in April at a small pond in southern Ontario, Canada, arriving before sunrise to find a perfect spot where the sun would be at my back. I was fully camouflaged in the cattails with my decoy ducks.”

title: Porth Nanven by Julian Harrison-Jones
text:
Porth Nanven by Julian Harrison-Jones
“Porth Nanven is a Cornish beach comprised of thousands of ‘dinosaur eggs’ –weathered stones over 100,000 years old that range from a few centimetres to a metre in size. Over time they have been shaped by the waves.”

title: See Them Play by Didan Rachmat
text:
See Them Play by Didan Rachmat
“One fine morning at a village. Lucky me to catch their happy expressions, curves that heal the world.”

title: Star Star by Eve North
text:
Star Star by Eve North
“This is myself and my little dog taken at a lake at nightfall in September. It was an Indian summer and the night was balmy and warm.”

title: Giallo e Verde by Massimo Feliziani
text:
Giallo e Verde by Massimo Feliziani
“I took this picture in the Marche region of Italy. During this period, spring explodes with a thousand colors. I got up very early on a beautiful April day as weather promised to be good for a photo shoot.”

title: Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full.
text:
Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full.
Like us on Facebook and share your work with us for the chance to be featured here and in the magazine!

title: Hooverphonic by Romain Ballez
text:
Hooverphonic by Romain Ballez
“This is a picture of Noémie Wolfs from the Belgian band Hooverphonic, taken in front of the Royal Palace, Brussels in early May during the Irisfeest.”

title: Batubolong Temple by Didan Rachmat
text:
Batubolong Temple by Didan Rachmat
“I was hoping for a low tide so I could go down and shot the rocks from the other side, but as the tide was high I instead captured this sunset view from a distance.”

title: The Three Sisters by Michael James
text:
The Three Sisters by Michael James
“A group of us often head out to the mountains in the fall to shoot the amazing colours. This was the last morning and the last frame I shot before packing it in for that location. Three Sisters is a mountain range that overlooks Canmore, Alberta, Canada.“

title: The First Mate by Joseph Corrado
text:
The First Mate by Joseph Corrado
“This was taken aboard the Schooner Olad out of Camden, Maine. It started out sunny, but we were soon engulfed in thick fog. The first mate, pictured here, was responsible for forward outlook duties.”

title: Sunset Reflection of Chobe by Mario Moreno
text:
Sunset Reflection of Chobe by Mario Moreno
“Elephants grazing at sunset in Chobe National Park in Botswana. This is just one of the many islands that appears when the Chobe river is at its highest level.”

title: On Cloud 9 by Thai Pham
text:
On Cloud 9 by Thai Pham
“This was taken in the morning near the entrance of the Flower Fields in Carlsbad, California. I saw this bed of African lilies and spent 30 minutes photographing them, so I knew my shot of the season would come from this!”

title: Wet by Charlotte Gravatt
text:
Wet by Charlotte Gravatt
“Dandelion seed heads are everywhere at this time of year, but it wasn’t until I looked closely that I saw they really are quite magical. I took this shot after the spring rain had stopped falling!”

title: Tiny Jumping Spider by David La Mason
text:
Tiny Jumping Spider by David La Mason
“I had originally set out to capture damselflies and dragonflies, but I was more than thrilled to find this tiny jumping spider sitting on the edge of a yellow iris petal, taking small hops in a circle.”

title: Indio by Marco Rank
text:
Indio by Marco Rank
“Processing character portraits requires you to know your subject’s personality and the unique story of their life. By using a full frame camera and lenses with fixed focal lengths at wide aperture, I tried to control the depth of field.”

title: Marbled White by Tim Tapley
text:
Marbled White by Tim Tapley
“On Salisbury Plain shortly before dusk on what had been a sunny evening, many butterflies began to look for somewhere to settle for the night,  and the opportunity arose to capture this marbled white at rest.”

title: Canada Goose Gosling by Jessica Kirste
text:
Canada Goose Gosling by Jessica Kirste
On my walk to the river I came across a family of Canada geese. The yellow and brown fuzz will sometimes have a light green tint so they blend in with the grasses. Nature’s design always amazes me!

title: Misty Sunrise by Robert Lachaine
text:
Misty Sunrise by Robert Lachaine
“I got up very early hoping to catch the sun rise over one of the lakes in Algonquin Park in Ontario. I spotted this scene as I came over the crest of a hill, so stopped to take this shot.”

title: Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full.
text:
Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full.
Like us on Facebook and share your work with us for the chance to be featured here and in the magazine!

title: Frog by Irawan Subingar
text:
Frog by Irawan Subingar
“While taking photos of other animals, I saw this strong silhouette of a tree frog and felt compelled to this this picture.”

title: Coomenoole Beach by Shane Turner
text:
Coomenoole Beach by Shane Turner
“Coomenoole Beach is situated on the Dingle Peninsula on the west coast of Ireland. It’s a surfer’s paradise. I took this shot on a wet and windy evening just above the sea cliff as the sun dipped below the horizon.”

title: Emperor of the Golden Fields by Neer Ildiko
text:
Emperor of the Golden Fields by Neer Ildiko
“I took this shot while on a trip to Őrség, Hungary. I went into a large field there each  evening to try to capture the atmosphere of the field as the sun set. I took this picture on one such evening.”

title: Sunset at Pushkar by Nimit Nigam
text:
Sunset at Pushkar by Nimit Nigam
“This was taken at Camel Pushkar Fair in Rajasthan in November 2012, the world’s biggest camel trade fair. I saw people doing a photo shoot with these camels. I loved how they were silhouetted, so I took this shot.”

title: Farmer’s Daughter by Ian Pettigrew
text:
Farmer’s Daughter by Ian Pettigrew
“This was taken at a rural farm in Fisherville, Ontario for Canadian fashion magazine ACF. It was a challenging shoot due to extreme winds and temperatures of about –5 Celsius. The model was a real trooper!”

title: Mallard Hatchlings by Cindy Bryant
text:
Mallard Hatchlings by Cindy Bryant
“My family and I witnessed mallard hatchlings overcome the mountainous neighbourhood terrain crossing the road. Attracting a small crowd, the mamma mallard stood close by to make sure all babies were accounted for before returning to the water.”

title: Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full.
text:
Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full. 
Like us on Facebook and share your work with us for the chance to be featured here and in the magazine! Our special thanks this week to Jacky Parker, Steve Docwra and Sean Foo.

title: Baltimore Oriole by Raymond Barlow
text:
Baltimore Oriole by Raymond Barlow
“I host photo tours in Costa Rica. This shot was taken on one such tour while we were staying at a coffee farm in the cloud forests of San Jose.”

title: Secret Marsh by Katherine Gendreau
text:
Secret Marsh by Katherine Gendreau
”I photographed this marsh in Kittery, Maine using a Hoya R72 infrared filter. I used a long exposure to create motion blur in the clouds as they moved over the marsh.”

title: Goodbye Cruel World… by Salah Baazizi
text:
Goodbye Cruel World… by Salah Baazizi
“This rock dove (or pigeon) landed next to me on the bridge at Bolsa Chica Ecological Reserve in California. As they live under the bridge, instead of taking to the sky like most birds, it dived down.”

title: Balconies by Mark Coe
text:
Balconies by Mark Coe
”This is a shot of the balconies of a new development of apartments along the seafront in Chalkwell Southend-On-Sea, England. They really stand out as the building is flanked by other dull-looking apartment blocks, so they have become something of a local landmark.”

title: Fascinating Beauty by Andrea Rapisarda
text:
Fascinating Beauty by Andrea Rapisarda
”I took this shot at the Rome Photoshow in March 2012. This beautiful model was posing on Sony’s stand at the event.”

title: Booted Warbler by Niranj Vaidyanathan
text:
Booted Warbler by Niranj Vaidyanathan
”To photograph this warbler, I lay on the ground at an angle that favoured good light and a background that would give me a good bokeh, and moved in closer along on the ground to avoid alert the bird.”

title: Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page.
text:
Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page.
Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full. Like us on Facebook and share your work with us for the chance to be featured here and in the magazine! Our special thanks this week to Fredy Mihaila, Yuga Kurita and Daniel Enderle.

title: Elisabetta by Paolo Mezzera
text:
Elisabetta by Paolo Mezzera
”Elisabetta is 13-years-old and from Italy. This image is part of a series of of shots published on my website. Usually I dislike black and white conversions, but in this case I really love how it works.”

title: The Sagrada Família by Daniel Borg
text:
The Sagrada Família by Daniel Borg
”The architecture and attention to detail in the building of The Sagrada Família is simply beautiful and I wanted to convey that beauty in one image. To capture this I used an Ultra Wide Angle lens.”

title: Hello Morning! by Celeste Mookherjee
text:
Hello Morning! by Celeste Mookherjee
”I love photographing morning glories because they can appear lit from within. When one is out of macro reach, I often switch to a zoom lens, which I did for this photograph.”

title: Midnight Reflections by Matthew Bleakley
text:
Midnight Reflections by Matthew Bleakley
“A pallid bat skims across a pond in southern Arizona. The yellow on the wings is pollen picked up by the bat. Off-camera flashes were fired using a custom-built infra-red trigger.”

title: Gelato by Kristina Kurtze
text:
Gelato by Kristina Kurtze
”This photo is of gelato with a candied orange slice. I used a Nikon SB800 with an umbrella to the right of the gelato and a reflector behind it and slightly to the left, angled towards the flash.”

title: Black Grouse by David Newby
text:
Black Grouse by David Newby
“This image of a male black grouse was taken on a private estate in the Yorkshire Dales, UK, in March 2012. After a very early start on a misty morning, the sun came out, and so did the grouse.”

title: The Big Eye by Vincent Bourrut
text:
The Big Eye by Vincent Bourrut
“This is the spiral staircase at Heal’s department store in London. I knew the picture I wanted to take – my aim was to bring out the detail in the wood.”

title: Sapa, Vietnam by Diego Arroyo
text:
Sapa, Vietnam by Diego Arroyo
“I took this shot of a Hmong woman in a rice field in the region of Sapa, in north Vietnam.”

title: By adegsm
text:
By adegsm
This unusual shot anthropomorphises the insects: positioned as they are, you can’t help but see them as two lovers, gazing into each other’s beady eyes, sitting in a romantic location atop a flower.

title: Schafsteize by Walter Hupfer
text:
Schafsteize by Walter Hupfer
“When I was out walking my dogs, we were observed suspiciously by a blue-headed wagtail, which was probably guarding its nest. When it perched on a stalk of wheat, I took this photo.”

title: The Sky’s The Limit by Yosuke Kobayashi
text:
The Sky’s The Limit by Yosuke Kobayashi
“These buildings stand at the southern end of Manhattan. The tallest you can see here is One World Trade Center, which is under construction.”

title: Alone by Natasha Palmer
text:
Alone by Natasha Palmer
“This image represents someone being abandoned. The Princess Bride by William Golman inspired the costume and the location. I darkened the image in Photoshop and added the rays of light.”

title: Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full.
text:
Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full.
Like us on Facebook and share your work with us for the chance to be featured here and in the magazine!

title: Richard by Matthew Davis
text:
Richard by Matthew Davis
“While walking around the streets of Tulsa, Oklahoma, I ran into this man named Richard. He and I had a long talk that included a number of life lessons. He was a very encouraging man.”

title: Pandora by Yury Pustovoy
text:
Pandora by Yury Pustovoy
“I took this in Wulingyuan, in China’s Hunan Province. This is a UNESCO World Heritage Site, where quartzite sandstone pillars – some over 800 metres high – tower into the sky.”

title: Devil’s Bridge by Marcel Fischer
text:
Devil’s Bridge by Marcel Fischer
“This is the Devil’s Bridge in the small town of Bobbio, in Piacenza, northern Italy. The bridge is the landmark of the town, which looks very picturesque in the evening light.”

title: When In Fiji by Sarah Lee
text:
When In Fiji by Sarah Lee
“Alison Teal, a surfer and filmmaker, dives beneath a surfer in Fiji. We spent a few hours in the water dodging surfers and big waves, and got this right before being called back to the boat.”

title: A Snowy Morning by Josh Clark
text:
A Snowy Morning by Josh Clark
“I photographed this snowy owl during a two-day excursion to Damon Point, Washington. The sun was just coming over the horizon as I snapped him perched atop of a piece of driftwood.”

title: Union Terrace Swimmers’ Pier At Sunrise by Cassius Callender
text:
Union Terrace Swimmers’ Pier At Sunrise by Cassius Callender
“I took this shot of Lake Medota in Madison, Wisconsin at 5:24am. It was a calm morning with just a touch of fog, which appeared to blend lake and sky. The clouds give a sense of viewing the Earth from above.”

title: Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full.
text:
Every Wednesday we feature the very best photography that has been shared to our Facebook page. Click on the images to see these fantastic photographs in full. 
Like us on Facebook and share your work with us for the chance to be featured here and in the magazine! Our special thanks this week to Sean Foo, Lisabella Photographie, Maxime Dugenet, Sarah M, and Adam Levy.

title: This Is Not Me by Sabina Miklowitz
text:
This Is Not Me by Sabina Miklowitz
“For this self-portrait, I used Photoshop to see how glamorous I could make myself look. It disturbed me to see how many of my friends were unaware how much of it had been retouched.”
